question: The "Los Haitises National Park" is located in which country?
explanation: The Los Haitises National Park is located in the Samana Bay of the island country of the Dominican Republic in the Hispaniola Islands of the Greater Antilles Archipelago in the West Indies-Caribbean region. This national park established in 1976 consists of a limestone karst plateau with conical hills, sinkholes and caverns, mangrove forest on the coast. In Taino language, Los Haitises means "hilly land". This national park houses endangered Ridgway's Hawk, the Hispaniolan Piculet, the Hispaniola Woodpecker, the Hispaniola Emerald. This national park, which hosts several rainforests, was a film location for the feature film "Jurassic Park".
